poem:
"Pigs and Power"

In the morning papers,  
politics reads like fable.  
Pigs stand upright, speaking  
in human tongues,  
masking truth behind mighty slogans.  

Egalitarian dreams crumble as  
once-equal beasts bow to swine,  
trotters trample an altered tale.  
Look not far for this reality,  
observe, disillusioned, your own barnyard.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Animal Farm review – Orwell’s unsettling allegory still resonates in the age of Trump, Johnson and Sunak How George Orwell would despair at today’s political discourse. His power-grabbing pigs in Animal Farm were an allegorical warning against Soviet-style dictatorship and propaganda. The more unequal the once egalitarian animal collective becomes, the more the ruling pig class rewrite their story. Today, you do not need to look to totalitarian states to see politicians manipulate the narrative.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
